CARDINAL . “ Preventive measures ” or “ restrictive measures ” can be imposed on a defendant in order to assure the execution of the sentence , if it is subsequently imposed , or for the extradition purposes ( Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW ( the “ CCrP ” ) ) .
CARDINAL . “ Preventive measures ” or “ restrictive measures ” include an undertaking not to leave a town or region , a personal guarantee , bail and remand in custody ( LAW CCrP ) .
